items.title: Xi Jinping appears with Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un at China military parade
items.standfirst: Trump criticises victory day event as China caps off a week of diplomatic grandstanding seen as a rebuke to the westChina military parade – follow it liveNorth Korean leader Kim Jong-un and Russia’s Vladimir Putin have appeared alongside Xi Jinping at a large military parade in Beijing on Wednesday, capping a week of diplomatic grandstanding by the Chinese president and his allies seen as a rebuke to the west.In unprecedented scenes, Xi shook the hands of both leaders and chatted with the pair as they walked down a red carpet towards Tiananmen Square and the parade to mark 80 years since the end of the second world war. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin hails ties with China as Kim Jong-un arrives in Beijing on eve of parade
items.standfirst: Russian president says relations at ‘unprecedentedly high level’ as dozens of leaders gather for Victory Day eventsVladimir Putin has hailed Russia’s “unprecedentedly” high level of ties with China, as dozens of leaders including the North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un, arrived in Beijing on the eve of a massive military parade intended to showcase a Chinese-led global order.Putin called China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a “dear friend” after the two held talks at the Great Hall of the People and then at Xi’s personal residence. “Our close communication reflects the strategic nature of Russia-China relations, which are at an unprecedentedly high level,” Putin told Xi, according to a video on the Kremlin’s Telegram channel. “We were always together then, and we remain together now.” Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president says relations at ‘unprecedentedly high level’ as dozens of leaders gather for Victory Day eventsVladimir Putin has hailed Russia’s “unprecedentedly” high level of ties with China, as dozens of leaders including the North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un, arrived in Beijing on the eve of a massive military parade intended to showcase a Chinese-led global order.Putin called China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a “dear friend” after the two held talks at the Great Hall of the People and then at Xi’s personal residence. “Our close communication reflects the strategic nature of Russia-China relations, which are at an unprecedentedly high level,” Putin told Xi, according to a video on the Kremlin’s Telegram channel. “We were always together then, and we remain together now.” Continue reading...

items.title: How China’s XXL military parade puts its military and territorial ambitions on show
items.standfirst: Wednesday’s military parade in Beijing celebrating the 80-year anniversary of China’s victory over Japan in World War II seems set to position China as the natural leader of a rival bloc to the Western international order – while at the same time pushing a historical narrative that seeks to justify President Xi Jinping’s territorial claims on Taiwan.
items.content: Wednesday’s military parade in Beijing celebrating the 80-year anniversary of China’s victory over Japan in World War II seems set to position China as the natural leader of a rival bloc to the Western international order – while at the same time pushing a historical narrative that seeks to justify President Xi Jinping’s territorial claims on Taiwan.

ai_summary: China held a large military parade to commemorate the end of World War II.
Xi Jinping, Vladimir Putin, and Kim Jong-un appeared together at the parade.
The parade showcased China's newest and most advanced military weapons.
Donald Trump accused China of conspiring against the United States.
World leaders from Russia, North Korea, Iran, and Myanmar attended the event.

items.title: U.S. conducts strike on boat from Venezuela
items.standfirst: The White House released video of a lethal strike on a boat in the southern Caribbean. President Trump says the boat was carrying drugs from Venezuela and that the strike killed 11 members of a notorious gang. Tensions with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro are rapidly escalating. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has the late details.
items.content: The White House released video of a lethal strike on a boat in the southern Caribbean. President Trump says the boat was carrying drugs from Venezuela and that the strike killed 11 members of a notorious gang. Tensions with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro are rapidly escalating. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has the late details.

items.title: Trump confirms U.S. strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat

items.content: President Trump says the U.S. military has struck a drug-laden vessel in the southern Caribbean after it left Venezuela. The strike comes a week after Washington deployed warships to the region.(Image credit: Daniel Gonzalez)

items.title: US conducts ‘kinetic strike’ against drug boat from Venezuela, killing 11, Trump says
items.standfirst: Trump says ‘we took it out’ referring to the operation in international waters, amid US-Caracas tensions The US military has killed 11 drug traffickers from Venezuela during a “a kinetic strike” in the Caribbean Sea, the US president, Donald Trump, has claimed amid growing tensions between Washington and Caracas.Trump trailed the announcement during an address at the White House on Tuesday afternoon, telling reporters the US had “just, over the last few minutes, literally shot out … a drug-carrying boat”. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump says ‘we took it out’ referring to the operation in international waters, amid US-Caracas tensions The US military has killed 11 drug traffickers from Venezuela during a “a kinetic strike” in the Caribbean Sea, the US president, Donald Trump, has claimed amid growing tensions between Washington and Caracas.Trump trailed the announcement during an address at the White House on Tuesday afternoon, telling reporters the US had “just, over the last few minutes, literally shot out … a drug-carrying boat”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The U.S. military conducted a strike on a Venezuelan drug vessel in the Caribbean.
President Trump stated the strike targeted "narcoterrorists" and killed 11 people.
The operation occurred in international waters, according to reports.
The strike is the first time the administration used deadly force on drug vessels.
The attack comes amid rising tensions between the U.S. and Venezuela.

items.title: US House committee releases more than 33,000 pages of Jeffrey Epstein files
items.standfirst: Files appear to contain information already in public domain as calls grow for release of all pertinent documents The US House of Representatives oversight committee on Tuesday released thousands of pages of records related to the disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein from the department of justice.The release comes as the Trump administration has been embroiled in months of controversy over its decision not to release additional files in the case. Epstein died by suicide in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges and was alleged to have abused hundreds of girls. Continue reading...
items.content: Files appear to contain information already in public domain as calls grow for release of all pertinent documents The US House of Representatives oversight committee on Tuesday released thousands of pages of records related to the disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein from the department of justice.The release comes as the Trump administration has been embroiled in months of controversy over its decision not to release additional files in the case. Epstein died by suicide in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges and was alleged to have abused hundreds of girls. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A House committee released over 33,000 pages of Epstein-related documents.
The documents came from the Justice Department's investigation.
Some lawmakers are pushing for a complete release of all files.
Many of the released files were already in the public domain.
Epstein died by suicide while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

clusters.title: World's Largest Group Of Genocide Scholars Finds Israel Guilty

items.title: World's Largest Group Of Genocide Scholars Finds Israel Guilty
items.standfirst: World's Largest Group Of Genocide Scholars Finds Israel Guilty The world's largest group of genocide scholars has overwhelmingly approved a resolution asserting that Israel's actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide. "The government of Israel has engaged in systematic and widespread…
items.content: World's Largest Group Of Genocide Scholars Finds Israel Guilty The world's largest group of genocide scholars has overwhelmingly approved a resolution asserting that Israel's actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide. "The government of Israel has engaged in systematic and widespread…

items.title: Israel prepares for new offensive in Gaza amid accusations of genocide
items.standfirst: Israel says it's identifying more targets in northern and central Gaza as its military plans to enter Gaza's largest city. The planned offensive comes just days after Israel was accused of committing genocide by the International Association of Genocide Scholars. Holly Williams has the latest.
items.content: Israel says it's identifying more targets in northern and central Gaza as its military plans to enter Gaza's largest city. The planned offensive comes just days after Israel was accused of committing genocide by the International Association of Genocide Scholars. Holly Williams has the latest.

items.title: Will resolution on Gaza by genocide scholars make a difference?
items.standfirst: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says Israel is committing genocide.
items.content: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says Israel is committing genocide.

items.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, scholars' association says
items.standfirst: The world's biggest academic association of genocide scholars has passed a resolution saying the legal criteria have been met to establish Israel is committing genocide in Gaza. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Timothy Williams, Vice President of the International Association of Genocide Scholars.
items.content: The world's biggest academic association of genocide scholars has passed a resolution saying the legal criteria have been met to establish Israel is committing genocide in Gaza. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Timothy Williams, Vice President of the International Association of Genocide Scholars.

items.title: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world’s top scholars on the crime say
items.standfirst: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...
items.content: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...

ai_summary: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says Israel is committing genocide.
The resolution was supported by 86% of the members who voted.
Israel is preparing for a new offensive in Gaza.
The planned offensive comes after accusations of genocide.
The association is the world's largest group of genocide scholars.

items.title: Sudan landslide kills at least 1,000 people, rebel group says
items.standfirst: Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivorMore than 1,000 people have been killed in a landslide in western Sudan, according to a rebel group that controls the area.The landslide on Sunday, which followed heavy rain, destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) said. Continue reading...

items.title: ‘There is death in every home’, families say, after at least 800 killed in Afghanistan earthquake – as it happened
items.standfirst: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...

items.title: At least 800 dead after magnitude-6 earthquake hits eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

items.title: French film star Depardieu to face trial accused of rape of actress Charlotte Arnould
items.standfirst: Film star Gerard Depardieu, one of the leading faces of French cinema, will face trial on charges of raping actress Charlotte Arnould in 2018, in the latest blow to his reputation after he was convicted of sexual assault earlier this year. Arnould first accused Depardieu of rape in 2018, saying the assaults occurred in his Paris home on two separate occasions when she was in her early 20s. Depardieu, 76, has denied wrongdoing in the case.

Depardieu, 76, has denied wrongdoing in the case.

ai_summary: A judge ruled against breaking up Google in a major antitrust case.
The judge is barring Google from exclusive deals for its search engine as default.
The ruling concerns Google's deals to make its search engine the default on devices.
The judge stopped short of banning Google's multi-billion dollar deals.
The case involves Google's practices in the search engine market.

clusters.title: Government unable to calculate Afghan data breach cost, watchdog says
clusters.neutral_headline: Government unable to calculate Afghan data breach cost, watchdog says

items.title: Government unable to calculate Afghan data breach cost, watchdog says
items.standfirst: The National Audit Office says it has not been given enough information to have "confidence" a relocation scheme cost £850m.
items.content: The National Audit Office says it has not been given enough information to have "confidence" a relocation scheme cost £850m.

items.title: More than 7,300 Afghans to be resettled in UK after MoD data leak, says National Audit Office
items.standfirst: Watchdog’s report says government is unable to calculate exact cost of response to data breach, raising doubt over £850m estimateMore than 7,300 Afghans are expected to be resettled in the UK as a result of a major government data breach, according to a National Audit Office report that raises doubts over officials’ claims of a £850m cost.The accidental leak by an MoD official in 2022 of 18,700 Afghans’ details who had worked with or for the British government led to the opening of a new route by which those endangered could seek relocation to the UK from their home country. Continue reading...
items.content: Watchdog’s report says government is unable to calculate exact cost of response to data breach, raising doubt over £850m estimateMore than 7,300 Afghans are expected to be resettled in the UK as a result of a major government data breach, according to a National Audit Office report that raises doubts over officials’ claims of a £850m cost.The accidental leak by an MoD official in 2022 of 18,700 Afghans’ details who had worked with or for the British government led to the opening of a new route by which those endangered could seek relocation to the UK from their home country. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The National Audit Office says it lacks sufficient information to assess the cost of the breach.
The government's estimated cost for the relocation scheme is £850 million.
Over 7,300 Afghans are expected to be resettled in the UK due to the breach.
The data breach involved the accidental leak of 18,700 Afghans' details.
The leak led to a new route for relocation to the UK.

items.title: Elon Musk Says Optimus Robots to Make Up About 80% of Tesla’s Value
Tesla Will Derive 80% of Its Value From Optimus Robot, Musk Says
items.standfirst: Elon Musk is deemphasizing Tesla Inc.’s car business like never before in favor of humanoid robots that are still in development and a ways off from generating revenue.
items.content: Elon Musk is deemphasizing Tesla Inc.’s car business like never before in favor of humanoid robots that are still in development and a ways off from generating revenue.

ai_summary: Elon Musk is emphasizing humanoid robots over Tesla's car business.
Musk believes Optimus robots will constitute 80% of Tesla's value.
The robots are still in development and not yet generating revenue.
Musk is de-emphasizing Tesla's car business.
The focus on robots is a significant shift in Tesla's strategy.

clusters.title: France issues arrest warrant for Syria’s Assad over killing of journalists
clusters.neutral_headline: France Issues Arrest Warrant for Syria’s Assad Over Killing of Journalists

items.title: France issues arrest warrant for Syria’s Assad over killing of journalists
items.standfirst: A French court issues the warrants in connection with the 2012 bombing in Homs that killed two journalists.
items.content: A French court issues the warrants in connection with the 2012 bombing in Homs that killed two journalists.

items.title: France issues arrest warrant for Syria's Assad over 2012 bombing that killed two journalists
items.standfirst: France on Tuesday issued arrest warrants for Syria's ousted president Bashar al-Assad and six other former officials for the 2012 bombing of the city of Homs that killed two journalists. Rights groups said the warrants pave the way for a trial in France for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed by Assad's regime.
items.content: France on Tuesday issued arrest warrants for Syria's ousted president Bashar al-Assad and six other former officials for the 2012 bombing of the city of Homs that killed two journalists. Rights groups said the warrants pave the way for a trial in France for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed by Assad's regime.

ai_summary: A French court issued arrest warrants for Bashar al-Assad and six other officials.
The warrants relate to the 2012 bombing in Homs that killed two journalists.
Rights groups say the warrants could lead to a trial in France.
The trial would be for war crimes and crimes against humanity.
The bombing occurred in the city of Homs.

clusters.title: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro

items.title: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Brazil’s Supreme Court began deliberations Tuesday in the historic trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro, an ally of Donald Trump, who is accused of plotting a coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. FRANCE 24's correspondent in Brazil Jan Onozsko describes the hearing as unprecedented, marking the first time a former Brazilian president has faced such a trial.
items.content: Brazil’s Supreme Court began deliberations Tuesday in the historic trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro, an ally of Donald Trump, who is accused of plotting a coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. FRANCE 24's correspondent in Brazil Jan Onozsko describes the hearing as unprecedented, marking the first time a former Brazilian president has faced such a trial.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro faces justice over alleged attempt to usurp Brazilian democracy
items.standfirst: Former president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after losing 2022 electionBrazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro and seven of his allies, including four senior members of the military, have gone on trial for allegedly attempting to stage a coup – the first time in Brazilian history such powerful figures have faced justice for seeking to topple the country’s democracy.Bolsonaro, a paratrooper turned far-right populist who governed from 2019 until 2023, stands accused of masterminding a failed power grab after losing the 2022 election to the leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after losing 2022 electionBrazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro and seven of his allies, including four senior members of the military, have gone on trial for allegedly attempting to stage a coup – the first time in Brazilian history such powerful figures have faced justice for seeking to topple the country’s democracy.Bolsonaro, a paratrooper turned far-right populist who governed from 2019 until 2023, stands accused of masterminding a failed power grab after losing the 2022 election to the leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Brazil's Supreme Court began deliberations in the trial of Jair Bolsonaro.
Bolsonaro is accused of plotting a coup after losing the 2022 election.
The trial is considered unprecedented in Brazilian history.
Seven others, including military members, are also on trial.
Bolsonaro governed Brazil from 2019 to 2023.

clusters.title: GPS jamming of leader's plane puts Putin's hybrid warfare on Europe's radar
clusters.neutral_headline: GPS jamming of leader's plane puts Putin's hybrid warfare on Europe's radar

items.title: GPS jamming of leader's plane puts Putin's hybrid warfare on Europe's radar
items.standfirst: NATO said Tuesday it was working to prevent Russian GPS jamming after a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen lost satellite navigation over Bulgaria.
items.content: NATO said Tuesday it was working to prevent Russian GPS jamming after a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen lost satellite navigation over Bulgaria.

items.title: Italy considers hiding state flight paths after jamming of von der Leyen plane
items.standfirst: EU member states debate how to make leaders’ flights more secure as Russia blamed for GPS lossItaly is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said.Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite navigation aids, delaying its arrival in Plovdiv, and reportedly forcing it to circle an airport for an hour. Continue reading...
items.content: EU member states debate how to make leaders’ flights more secure as Russia blamed for GPS lossItaly is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said.Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite navigation aids, delaying its arrival in Plovdiv, and reportedly forcing it to circle an airport for an hour. Continue reading...

ai_summary: NATO is working to prevent Russian GPS jamming.
A plane carrying Ursula von der Leyen lost satellite navigation over Bulgaria.
Italy is considering hiding state flight paths due to the jamming.
The incident delayed von der Leyen's arrival and forced circling.
Russia is being blamed for the alleged GPS jamming.
